textAfterTable: 4 Songs Customer Reviews ORIGINAL HIT VERSIONS!           by D-J Ross Don't let the generic CD cover scare you away; these are the ORIGINAL Maxine Brown hit recordings [some even in stereo]. I know, Gusto Records has a reputation for re-recordings, but [in this case] they nabbed the original Wand-label masters from parent company Scepter Records. Only three stars for this release because I wanted a FULL ALBUM, not just an EP! Biography Born: August 18, 1939 in Kingstree, SC Genre: R&B/Soul Years Active: '60s, '70s, '80s, '90s, '00s, '10s Although she never had many hits, Maxine Brown was one of the most underrated soul and R&B vocalists of the '60s. During the '60s she released a series of singles for Nomar and Wand, with only a couple of songs — "All in My Mind," "Funny," "Something You Got," "Oh No Not My Baby" — managing to become either pop or R&B hits.
